full_summary:
**Workplace Booking Tool Request for Information**

The National Capital Commission (NCC) issues this Request for Information (RFI) to gather information on tools used to manage workplace bookings. Our goal is to identify suitable solutions to manage bookings for staff at our new headquarters in Ottawa. The selected tool should enable staff to reserve and check-in to workstations and diverse types of work points.

**Objective**

We invite potential suppliers to provide information on various workplace booking tools available, including features and functionalities affecting users, such as staff, Human Resources, and Facilities Management. We are also interested in different booking models (e.g., floors, neighborhoods, individual workstations).

**Information Requirements**

To facilitate the evaluation process, we kindly request that respondents provide the following information:
* Type and functionalities of workplace booking tools
* Experience with similar projects or implementations
* Cost estimates and proposed methodologies for implementation
* References and notable projects undertaken
* Contact information for a single point of contact, including name, email address, phone number, and position title

**Submission and Return of Responses**

Respondents are to submit their responses via email to: [Bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca](mailto:Bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca). Please include the reference number PL013 in the email subject line. The deadline for responses is [2023-09-13T15:00:00](https://www.rfpblog.com/tools/rfpx/).

We prefer email communication, which should be directed to the above email. It is not necessary that all responses be shared with other respondents.

Queries regarding this RFI must be directed to: [philippe.lupien@ncc-ccn.ca](mailto:philippe.lupien@ncc-ccn.ca). Please ensure that the subject line states: Response to RFI – Workplace Booking Tool.

**Background and Clarification**

This RFI is a non-binding inquiry and does not imply a commitment to proceed with a formal procurement process. The information provided will be used to help the NCC make informed decisions regarding the acquisition of a workplace booking tool.

For more information, please access the tender notice document: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/8270/workplace_booking_tool_rfi_en_final_08172023_0.pdf> (English) or <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/8270/workplace_booking_tool_rfi
